>>f5f06112-c967-4203-afa1-9e75b53e74af
zeronet only uses 4GB of disk on my machine, so realistically, decent seeder machines should use SSD or flash drive. an emphasis on cheap embedded machines are a better general focus if having more seeders is the goal.

> raspberry pi should be ok for seeding, if files are on flash drive etc. to keep sd card from burning out. basic setups use <20W power

> old laptops with screens removed are good, with max power consumption usually <100W

> desktop/server is overkill as of now

>>e998b660-cd71-4dca-96a6-8d0ba3613285
I guess I would argue that for important things, 1080p HD video is not a requirement. if videos were compressed to 480p, that much disk space would not be required.

in general rack mounted raspberry pis are ridiculous and expensive to the average person, money would better spent on a server case and passive cooled celeron or a regular computer

a single raspberry pi with flash drive makes the most sense per unit, especially if there's a lot of them spread out across multiple internet connections. the newer ones come with a decent ethernet port and usb-c

it may make sense to make raspberry pi image specifically for 08chan that people could write to sd cards like how raspbian works 

large drives don't really matter for 08chan if there's no content to store anyhow

>>535281f7-0b8a-4f32-8556-2698a58297fb
I guess you can brush it off as ad-hominem if you want, but there is a very real cultural problem here and maybe you just aren't around as many wealthy people as I, or you just don't realize your own wealth, I wouldn't know.

Of those I know who are left-leaning, and I would call friends, there's only one person who won't turn and sputter in rage when their views are questioned. Few know how much groceries cost,  or have ever used a coin-operated washing machine.

Meanwhile those who are right-leaning offer jokes and/or sources that can be insightful. They also appreciate more the value of what they earn relative to how much they spend. Some will even openly mock themselves as stupid, cause they don't know everything.

You might be that 1 in 10 that's fun to talk to, but your post leans so heavily on your ideals and need to win that you might not be. 

You might even be correct, especially with your last point. But the need to be correct is something that I would add as another cultural problem alongside the consumers.

To use ad-hominem as a means to deflect criticism might be valid in a debate sense, but if you want to treat everything as a debate then nobody will want to talk to you.

I don't remember any list of seeds, though I do have the MT block list installed.

it's possible that if you're routed through tor that you just might be on a bad node for zeronet, and would need to switch nodes.

if you're not routed through tor, you should be routed through tor.

my setup
- PC is always on, uptime of 75 days
- everything is through tor
- mt blocklist
- zeronet commit 5aa115c88acda0baa3951ffe9c74a8ed110309ca

there's like 150 connectable people, of which 100 are through tor
here's what the zeronet.conf looks like when tor is enabled

>>72a20b7c-3648-4847-8ff2-605f9a5d94c8
[global]
tor = always
fileserver_port = 27941
just loaded up on another client on a different tor node and network, 280 connectable, damn that's a big difference

posts.subject: What is the current state of ZeroID?
posts.body:
1. does 08chan still require ZeroID to post

2. does getting a new ZeroID still require clearnet access

3. what is the recommended practice that new users should use when acquiring their first ZeroID

>>df4213e4-9658-4e52-a1e7-3bc0e5ca2548

3. was related to 2, my implicit asking of whether new users should get their zeroid from clearnet or through tor was not clear

>>1274e6aa-b850-4e44-96f2-a60f1ff32acb
espanded:
should users deal with timeout issue on tor or get an id over the clearnet. if getting an id over the clearnet what would be considered good practice for someone that is just getting started with 08
